hanzi-su-wiki:
鋭

Значения

Острый; сообразительный

Мнемоника

Лезвие — глашатай 兑 качества оружия. Хороший звон металла 金 говорит о высоком качестве.

Варианты

銳, 锐

ruì
Japanese variant of 锐
Японский вариант 锐
rtega_mnemonic:
鋭鋭RSsharp, pointed
  • pointed metal 金 (knife) used to obtain money by big brother 兑
heisig_constituent: pointed, metal, gold, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs
heisig_story: Metal that has been pointed (as an awl, a pick, a nail, or a knife) tends to serve the devil's purposes as well as civilization's: our tools are also our weapons.
myStory: A beast 兄 with two horns 丷 = money, exchange, beast from the swamp, blend
Keyword_KANJIDIC: pointed, sharpness, edge, weapon, sharp, violent
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: заостренные, резкость, край, оружие, острые, насильственный
koohiiStory1: Pointed is the metal devil´s pitchfork.
koohiiStory2: The Horny teenager who worked part time at a gold smelting plant always had uncontrollable errections that pointed out all the time, this is not a good thing to have when you work in a gold smelting plant, surely he will one day end up with a Goldmember!
jp_example_words: 鋭い(するどい): pointed, sharp
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you have gold you also need a guard with a very sharp sword to protect it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You should probably also get some sharp spikes, sharp traps, and sharp spears to keep that gold safe too. Just a bunch of sharp stuff.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You're setting up all these sharp traps around your gold when you step on a sharp acorn (えい) that's just laying on the floor. Ouch! But wait, then you get a great idea!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine covering the floor around your gold in sharp acorns. This is basically a Home Alone situation, and anyone who tries to steal your stuff is gonna get stuck full of sharp things and probably stabbed by your guard.
Ru_Russian: острый (кончик ножа, лезвие, критика), острие (напр. меча)
Ru_Meaning: pointed, sharpness, edge, weapon, sharp, violent
Ru_Radicals: 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 儿 (ножки), 并, 口 (рот), 金 (золото)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the eight elder brothers (兑) with gold (金) must be sharp

鋭い(するどい): pointed, sharp

鋭字的基本解释

鋭
ruì
见“锐”。

鋭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［ruì］
［《廣韻》以芮切，去祭，以。］
“棁3”的被通假字。“兑3”的被通假字。“锐1”的繁体字。“銳1”的新字形。
(1)锋利；锐利。
(2)指使锋利、锐利。
(3)指锋利的武器。
(4)指精锐的部队，精锐的士卒。
(5)旺盛。
(6)指旺盛的气势。
(7)精细；敏锐。
(8)快速。
(9)急切；迫切。
(10)尖，底大顶小。
(11)（声音）刺耳。
(12)指物体尖端部分。
(13)通“悦”。
[②]［duì］
［《廣韻》杜外切，去泰，定。］
“锐2”的繁体字。“銳2”的新字形。
古兵器之一。矛属。一说“鈗”。之讹字。
[③]［yuè］
［《集韻》欲雪切，入薛，以。］
“锐3”的繁体字。“銳3”的新字形。

Yun
Name meaning
Nothing.
ruì
яп. вм. 锐
Radicals: 金, 兑  (gold, guard)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you have gold you also need a guard with a very sharp sword to protect it.
You should probably also get some sharp spikes, sharp traps, and sharp spears to keep that gold safe too. Just a bunch of sharp stuff.
Reading Mnemonic
You're setting up all these sharp traps around your gold when you step on a sharp acorn (えい) that's just laying on the floor. Ouch! But wait, then you get a great idea!
Imagine covering the floor around your gold in sharp acorns. This is basically a Home Alone situation, and anyone who tries to steal your stuff is gonna get stuck full of sharp things and probably stabbed by your guard.
